gobblin.config.store.hdfs

Class SimpleHadoopFilesystemConfigStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.config.store.hdfs.SimpleHadoopFilesystemConfigStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigStore, Deployable<FsDeploymentConfig>

    @ConfigStoreWithStableVersioning
public class SimpleHadoopFilesystemConfigStore
extends Object
implements ConfigStore, Deployable<FsDeploymentConfig>
    An implementation of ConfigStore backed by HDFS. The class assumes a simple file and directory layout structure where each path under the root store directory corresponds to a dataset. The getStoreURI() method gives an URI that identifies the HDFS cluster being used, as well as the root directory of the store. When querying this store, the scheme should be of the form simple-[hdfs-scheme] (a.k.a the logical scheme). For example, if the store is located on a the local filesystem the scheme should be simple-file, if the store is located on HDFS, the scheme should be simple-hdfs. This class can be constructed using a SimpleHDFSConfigStoreFactory.

    The class assumes a directory called CONFIG_STORE_NAME is under the root directory. This folder should contain a directory for each version deployed to the ConfigStore. An example directory structure could look like:

    /root
     /my-simple-store
      /_CONFIG_STORE
       /v1.0
        /dataset1
         /child-dataset
          /main.conf
          /includes.conf
        /dataset2
         /main.conf
         /child-dataset
          /main.conf

    In the above example, the root of the store is /root/my-simple-store/. The code automatically assumes that this folder contains a directory named CONFIG_STORE_NAME. In order to access the dataset dataset1/child-dataset using ConfigClient#getConfig(URI), the specified URI should be simple-hdfs://[authority]:[port]/root/my-simple-store/dataset1/child-dataset/. Note this is the fully qualified path to the actual MAIN_CONF_FILE_NAME file on HDFS, with the CONFIG_STORE_NAME and the version directories removed.

    All the Configs for a dataset should be put in the associated MAIN_CONF_FILE_NAME file, and all the imports should be put in the associated INCLUDES_CONF_FILE_NAME file.

    This class is not responsible for deploying configurations from an external source to HDFS, only for reading them.

    See Also:
    SimpleHDFSConfigStoreFactory

      • SimpleHadoopFilesystemConfigStore

        protected SimpleHadoopFilesystemConfigStore(FileSystem fs,
                                            URI physicalStoreRoot,
                                            URI logicalStoreRoot)
        Constructs a SimpleHadoopFilesystemConfigStore using a given FileSystem and a URI that points to the physical location of the store root.
        Parameters:
        fs - the FileSystem the ConfigStore is stored on.
        physicalStoreRoot - the fully qualified URI of the physical store root, the URI.getScheme() of the URI should match the FileSystem.getScheme() of the given FileSystem.
        logicalStoreRoot - the fully qualfied URI of the logical store root

      • getCurrentVersion

        public String getCurrentVersion()
        Returns a String representation of the active version stored in the ConfigStore. This method determines the current active version by reading the #CONFIG_STORE_METADATA_FILENAME in CONFIG_STORE_NAME
        Specified by:
        getCurrentVersion in interface ConfigStore
        Returns:
        a String representing the current active version of the ConfigStore.

        Returns a URI representing the logical store URI where the URI.getPath() is the path to the root of the ConfigStore.

        Returns:
        a URI representing the logical store URI (e.g. simple-hdfs://[authority]:[port][path-to-root]).

      • getChildren

        public Collection<ConfigKeyPath> getChildren(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                                             String version)
                                      throws VersionDoesNotExistException
        Retrieves all the children of the given ConfigKeyPath by doing a ls on the Path specified by the ConfigKeyPath. If the Path described by the ConfigKeyPath does not exist, an empty Collection is returned.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface ConfigStore
        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose children are necessary.
        version - specify the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        a Collection of ConfigKeyPath where each entry is a child of the given configKey.
        Throws:
        VersionDoesNotExistException - if the version specified cannot be found in the ConfigStore.

      • getOwnImports

        public List<ConfigKeyPath> getOwnImports(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                                         String version)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigStore
        Obtains the list of all config keys with which are given config key is tagged/annotated.
        Specified by:
        getOwnImports in interface ConfigStore
        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose tags are needed
        version - the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        the paths of the directly imported config keys for the specified config key and version. Note that order is significant the earlier ConfigKeyPath in the List will have higher priority when resolving configuration conflicts.

      • getOwnImports

        public List<ConfigKeyPath> getOwnImports(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                                         String version,
                                         Optional<Config> runtimeConfig)
                                  throws VersionDoesNotExistException
        Retrieves all the ConfigKeyPaths that are imported by the given ConfigKeyPath. This method does this by reading the INCLUDES_CONF_FILE_NAME file associated with the dataset specified by the given ConfigKeyPath. If the Path described by the ConfigKeyPath does not exist, then an empty List is returned.
        Specified by:
        getOwnImports in interface ConfigStore
        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose tags are needed
        version - the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        a List of ConfigKeyPaths where each entry is a ConfigKeyPath imported by the dataset specified by the configKey.
        Throws:
        VersionDoesNotExistException - if the version specified cannot be found in the ConfigStore.

                                               Optional<Config> runtimeConfig)
        A helper to resolve System properties and Environment variables in includes paths The method loads the list of unresolved includes into an in-memory Config object and reolves with a fallback on ConfigFactory.defaultOverrides()

        Returns:

        public Config getOwnConfig(ConfigKeyPath configKey,
                           String version)
                    throws VersionDoesNotExistException
        Retrieves the Config for the given ConfigKeyPath by reading the MAIN_CONF_FILE_NAME associated with the dataset specified by the given ConfigKeyPath. If the Path described by the ConfigKeyPath does not exist then an empty Config is returned.
        Specified by:
        getOwnConfig in interface ConfigStore
        Parameters:
        configKey - the config key path whose properties are needed.
        version - the configuration version in the configuration store.
        Returns:
        a Config for the given configKey.
        Throws:
        VersionDoesNotExistException - if the version specified cannot be found in the ConfigStore.

      • deploy

        public void deploy(FsDeploymentConfig deploymentConfig)
            throws IOException
        Deploy configs provided by FsDeploymentConfig#getDeployableConfigSource() to HDFS. For each ConfigStream returned by DeployableConfigSource.getConfigStreams(), creates a resource on HDFS.
          Does the following:
        • Read ConfigStreams and write them to HDFS
        • Create parent directories of ConfigStream#getConfigPath() if required
        • Set FsDeploymentConfig#getStorePermissions() to all resourced created on HDFS
        • Update current active version in the store metadata file.

        For example: If "test-root" is a resource in classpath and all resources under it needs to be deployed,

        In Classpath:

        test-root
         /data
          /set1
           /main.conf
         /tag
          /tag1
           /main.conf

        A new version 2.0.0 FsDeploymentConfig#getNewVersion() is created on HDFS under this.physicalStoreRoot/_CONFIG_STORE

        On HDFS after deploy:

        /_CONFIG_STORE
         /2.0.0
          /data
           /set1
            /main.conf
          /tag
           /tag1
            /main.conf

        Specified by:
        deploy in interface Deployable<FsDeploymentConfig>
        Parameters:
        deploymentConfig - to use for this deployment
        Throws:
        IOException

        URI getPhysicalStoreRoot()
